news.title: City traders jailed for interest rate-rigging have convictions quashed
news.summary: Tom Hayes and Carlo Palombo said for a decade they were victims of a series of miscarriages of justice relating to the manipulation of Libor and Euribor interest rates.

news.title: Recorded MasterChef series will air with sacked hosts, BBC confirms
news.summary: The amateurs series was filmed last year featuring sacked hosts Gregg Wallace and John Torode.

news.title: 'There will never be another Ozzy': Stars pay tribute to rock legend
news.summary: The frontman of pioneering heavy metal band Black Sabbath has died in the UK at the age of 76.

news.title: Two dead and two seriously injured after NI shooting
news.summary: Emergency services remain at the scene in Maguiresbridge, but police say there is no ongoing risk to the public.

news.title: I don't care about my age, 19-year-old Reform council leader tells BBC
news.summary: George Finch, the UK's youngest council leader at 19, had thought he would become a history teacher.

news.title: Chaos and comebacks: How England keep overcoming the odds
news.summary: England have overcome all odds to reach the Euro 2025 final - so how have they done it?

news.title: Home Office to share asylum hotel data with food delivery firms
news.summary: The agreement is aimed at helping companies identify migrants who are working illegally in the UK.

news.title: Erik Menendez taken to hospital with 'serious' condition, lawyer tells US media
news.summary: It comes weeks before he and his brother are expected at a parole hearing, after decades in US prison.

news.title: 'A hospital gave us two death certificates for dad to cover up their mistake'
news.summary: Brian Holmes died at Castle Hill hospital, near Hull, which is at the centre of a police investigation.

news.title: Heathrow boss 'frustrated' at being asleep during fire that caused airport closure
news.summary: Thomas Woldbye said it wasn't normally the way he acted as a power outage disrupted 1,300 flights.
